question: Who among the following related to Khasi Uprising (1829-32)?
explanation:
Khasi Uprising (1829-32): This tribal movement was led by Tirut Singh (ruler of Nunklow) and Bharmanik , who fought against
British attempts to take over control of the Khasi Hills. In 1832, the war ended when British captured Tirut Singh, as one of his  chief betrayed him for some pieces of gold. He died on July 17,1835. His death anniversary is commemorated every year as a  state holiday in Meghalaya.
